meanings.definition: Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native.
meanings.sent1: The plants in this forest are indigenous to this area.
meanings.sent2: The tribe's customs are deeply rooted in their indigenous culture.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the indigenous birds teaching the city pigeons how to fly.
meanings.sent4: Her artistry had an indigenous quality that captivated all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The indigenous aroma of the spices filled the kitchen with warmth and flavor.

meanings.sent1: His talent for music seemed indigenous to his very soul.
meanings.sent2: The scientist believed that curiosity is an indigenous trait in humans.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch the indigenous love for ice cream overcome even the strictest diet.
meanings.sent4: The indigenous drive to explore new horizons led her to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The indigenous sense of humor in the group made every gathering a joyous occasion.
